area_name: Back Porch slabs and Jump Back Rock, The

content.description: Fantastic training for the aspiring slab-master. Begin on good feet and move to thin hands and smears at thin flakes. Reach for a good hand then pad up the sloping top-out.
content.location: Located on the Southeast side of the Back Porch Slab. Start about midway between a left-facing corner on the right and a jumble of rocks on the left.

content.description: Finger-tips, dime-edged feet and smearing are the name of the game on this problem. Begin below a dark brown, angular flake. Enjoy the shady start and climb into the sun on a sloping top-out. Descend to climbers right.
content.location: This problem is located on the southeast side of the Back Porch Slab, just left of "The Finale."
West face of Jump Back Rock on the right .

content.description: Climb large, slightly chossy huecos to the top of the overhanging prow.
content.protection: Bad landing, pads!! Or don't fall.
content.location: Northeast side of Jump Back Rock

content.description: Climb the face, located to the right of Flashdance, up and to the right over the rounded top.  Requires some thin edging and smearing.  There is an oddly shaped, sort of round indention about half-way up the route, that can be used for both a hand and foot placement.  This route will definitely force beginners to trust their shoes.  The corner of Flashdance is off.
content.location: The face immediately to the right of Flashdance.  The corner of Flashdance is off.

content.description: Follow the obvious corner to the top.  This is another good route for teaching children or beginning climbers.
content.protection: Either crash pad or TR.  See the Back Porch Slab description for more details.
content.location: See the Back Porch Slab description for more details.

content.description: Climb the thinly featured face just left of a left-facing corner and crack. A shallow mono-pocket and smears bring you to the top. Walk-off/down-climb to climbers right.
content.protection: Pad. Somewhat uneven landing. Spotter recommended
content.location: Located on the south east side of the Back Porch Slab just left of a left-facing corner/crack

content.description: Traverse starting left of the Back Porch Slab route and ending to the right of Grunt and Groan.

This is the obvious route just to the right of Flashdance.  The bottom of the route requires smearing and/or standing on small edges, so it is a good route for teaching kids or first time adults.  If you have a kid without climbing shoes, just give them a boost to the crack running from the middle to the top.
content.protection: Optional;  The 'crux' is near the bottom.  Crash pad or TR.  There is a tree and a couple of boulders at the top which can be used for anchors.  You'll need some long slings or webbing.
content.location: From the top, you can walk off the route by continuing up then to the left.  Go underneath the small boulder bridge and left when back on the ground.

content.description: For further advancement of your slab-master craft. Begin with decent feet and palm smears moving to tiny edges and foot smears.
content.protection: Pad. Funky landing between blocks. Spotter recommended.
content.location: Located on the far left of the south east side of the Back Porch Slab, just right of a jumble of blocks.

pathTokens: Back Porch slabs and Jump Back Rock, The

content.description:
The Back Porch is counterpart to "The Front Porch" up at Granite Mountain....  

  This area includes The Back Porch Slabs, as well as Jump Back Rock.
